title: What a SCAREDY cat! Moment mischievous lion cub gives her mother a fright by sneaking up behind her
text:
This hilarious video shows the moment a mischievous lion cub gave her mum a fright by sneaking up on her.

The clip shows a cub, which is less than two months old, creeping up on mum Roberta from behind while she looks on at another of her cubs.

After getting within range, the tiny cub pounces on her at the Royal Zoological Society of Scotland’s Edinburgh Zoo.

The lioness, an Asiatic lion, is seen jumping in shock before getting to her feet to see what’s going on.

Edinburgh Zoo shared the funny clip on social media with the caption: 'Trying to relax when you have little ones.'

In August, Roberta gave birth to a litter of five at the capital’s zoo - with only three surviving.

Their father Jayendra arrived in Edinburgh from Bristol Zoo in 2012, with Roberta following from Magdeburg Zoo in Germany two years later.

Asiatic lions, which are endangered, previously existed across southwest Asia but are now only found in Gir Forest National Park in India.

The wild population is estimated to be only 350, with threats including poaching, habitat destruction, conflict with humans and a declining number of prey animals.

Roberta and Jayendra are part of the European endangered species programme, with every birth being a potential lifeline and increasing the possibility of future generations being reintroduced into the wild.

RZSS Edinburgh Zoo were unavailable for comment.
description: This two-month-old lion cub snuck up on her mother Roberta in their enclosure at Scotland's Edinburgh Zoo, before giving the huge lioness the fright of her life.
